newsitem.title: USA: Magellan assets rose to $51.683 billion end August.
newsitem.headline: Magellan assets rose to $51.683 billion end August.

text.p: Fidelity Investments said the assets of its Magellan Fund rose to $51.683 billion at the end of August and to $51.913 billion on September 4 from $50.972 billion at the end of July.
However, at least one analyst said investors continued to redeem shares in the mutual fund, though at a slower pace than in recent months.
Eric Kobren, publisher of Fidelity Insight, told Reuters he estimates that investors redeemed from $580 million to $600 million in August, "which was less than what we saw in May, June or July."
"I think we're pretty safe that assets will stabilize here," Kobren said. "Investors should sort of sit tight and not pay as much attention to it as the media does."

Kobren estimated that investors have redeemed about $3.9 billion from Magellan since April and a total of $2.4 billion year-to-date after news of the fund's recent poor performance and change in fund managers.
